Hi Johannes,

I'm totally on Dawids side: Why do you need custom classloadi=
ng?
On the other hand, if you really, really need it, you may be able to
re=
alize it by wrapping surefire or JUnit (or both) somehow. And there is
alwa=
ys bytecode-manipulation. :-)
But then again: JUnit is no magic. You could =
even write your own very
simple test execution framework for your particula=
r problem. And you could
even base it on JUnits capabilities.
Just to spray=
 some more ideas...

Greetings,
   Malte
=E2=80=8B

--089e0122911ccb652e05166d5d0f
